step1.sentence: When the catering team was short-staffed, several colleagues pitched in to help set up the tables.

step2.story: The office renovation ran over budget by a small amount. Rather than delay the project, a few team members pitched in with ideas for cutting costs in other areas, and the work was completed on time.

step3.story: The community garden had not been tended properly all summer and was overgrown by September. One Saturday morning, a notice went out asking anyone free to come and help. By nine o'clock, fourteen people had shown up with gloves and tools. Nobody organized it formally; everyone just pitched in where they saw something that needed doing. By afternoon, the garden looked better than it had in years.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 공동의 목표를 위해 자발적으로 돕거나 기여하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 특별한 지시 없이 스스로 나서서 도움을 줄 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 야구에서 피칭(던지다)에서 유래하여 자신의 몫을 던져 넣는다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 자발성과 협력이 핵심 뉘앙스입니다. 특히 여러 사람이 함께 나서는 상황에 잘 어울립니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Everyone pitched in to get the office ready before the client visit.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 고객 방문 전에 모두가 힘을 보태서 사무실을 준비했어요.
